name: Cox's Bazar
details: Cox’s Bazar is a town on the southeast coast of Bangladesh. It’s known for its very long, sandy beachfront, stretching from Sea Beach in the north to Kolatoli Beach in the south. Aggameda Khyang monastery is home to bronze statues and centuries-old Buddhist manuscripts. South of town, the tropical rainforest of Himchari National Park has waterfalls and many birds. North, sea turtles breed on nearby Sonadia Island.

name: Sajek
details: Sajek Valley, located in the Chittagong Hill Tracts, is known for its stunning landscapes, lush green hills, and indigenous communities. It's a serene destination with beautiful views and a peaceful atmosphere.

name: Rangamati
details: Another picturesque location in the Chittagong Hill Tracts, Rangamati is famous for its large lake, Kaptai Lake. The area is known for its scenic beauty, indigenous cultures, and water activities.

name: Jaflong
details: Located in the northeastern part of Bangladesh, Jaflong is known for its tea gardens, hills, and the Dawki River. It's a beautiful area with scenic landscapes, making it a popular destination for nature lovers.

name: Saint Martin
details: Situated in the Bay of Bengal, Saint Martin's is the only coral island in Bangladesh. It's known for its pristine beaches, clear blue waters, and coral reefs, making it a popular destination for both domestic and international tourists.

name: Sundarban
details: The Sundarbans along the Bay of Bengal has evolved over the millennia through natural deposition of upstream sediments accompanied by intertidal segregation. The physiography is dominated by deltaic formations that include innumerable drainage lines associated with surface and subaqueous levees, splays and tidal flats. There are also marginal marshes above mean tide level, tidal sandbars and islands with their networks of tidal channels,

name: Himsori
details: The park is located at Ramu and Cox's Bazar Sadar Upazila, Cox's Bazar District, in the southeast region of the country. It is located mainly on the hills and is adjoining to Bay of Bengal to the west. Himchari National Park covers approximately 1,729 ha (17.29 km2) of mixed evergreen forests Biome.

name: Sri Mongol
details: It is famous for one of the largest tea gardens of the world which covers with lush green carpet. Most of the tea estates of Bangladesh are in Sreemangal. That's why this town is called the land of two leaves and a bud. It is also called the tea capital of Bangladesh because of many tea estates.

name: Sada Pathor
details: Sada Pathor (White Stone) Tourist Center is located at Bholaganj in Companiganj Upazila of Sylhet. Kompaniganj is a border Upazila located at a distance of 35 km from Sylhet city. And there is the kingdom of white stone (Sada Pathor).
